channel.title: Comments on: A New Perspective on Handicap Go

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: Haha. That is a funny coincidence. Hopefully my study of handicap go will help to alleviate your aversion to it as well. =D
item.content:encoded: Haha. That is a funny coincidence. Hopefully my study of handicap go will help to alleviate your aversion to it as well. =D

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: Anytime. I'm glad to know that we share the same sentiments. I certainly hope that my exploration into the world of handicap go will yield something helpful in my even games. =)
item.content:encoded: Anytime. I’m glad to know that we share the same sentiments. I certainly hope that my exploration into the world of handicap go will yield something helpful in my even games. =)

item.title: By: Moboy78
item.dc:creator: Moboy78
item.description: I remember something another go player on Sensei's Library once said about handicap go now that you mention this. It was something along the lines of when you're white in a handicap game, your game needs to go above and beyond what it normally is to win the game (assuming no conscious overplays), and as black you need to stay quite calm and focused to maintain your lead throughout the game. Your brother's quote on comfort zone reminded me of what this player said, and, like with your and Eyecather, reminded me that I should play more handicap go as well. Thanks for the post =).
item.content:encoded: I remember something another go player on Sensei’s Library once said about handicap go now that you mention this. item.title: By: Eyecatcher
item.dc:creator: Eyecatcher
item.description: It is very funny, that we both have similar feelings about much things (when it comes to go)! I hate handicape Go as well ... but i know that i should change my feelings about that. Thnx for the post, it helps ... ;-)
